result.execSummary:
All charges against Ralph L Salyers IV in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ralph L Salyers IV is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Court orders that the gun can be returned to the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ralph L Salyers IV

defendant.name: Salyers, Ralph L, IV
defendant.address: S55W23900 Briar Ridge Circle, Waukesha, WI 53189

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:43 PM 
Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ralph L Salyers in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw. 
State makes a motion to dismiss.
Court will dismiss the case without prejudice.
Court will order that the gun can be returned to the defendant.
Motion hearing on July 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

dated 07-20-2022 from the State of Wisconsin, Department of Justice, advising that they have decided not to appear in this matter at this time;  requesting the parties inform the DOJ if the matter is appealed and the appeal raises the issue of constitutionality.
Defendant's Amended Motion to Dismiss;  filed by Atty. Morgan Risseeuw
dated 07-18-2022 from Atty. Morgan Risseuw with attached an Amended Motion to Dismiss
Motion hearing on July 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ralph L Salyers in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw.   

The Court notes that the Defense file a Motion to Extend Deadline and Motion to Dismiss.
The State does not object to Motion to Extend Deadline.
The Court will grant the Defense's Motion to Extend Deadline.
The Defendant is still awaiting on discovery. 
The Court will schedule the motion to dismiss.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

08:25 AM Defendant Ralph L Salyers in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Attorney Risseeuw reserves her right for the Trial Court to hear the Motion to Dismiss.
The Court so grants.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
